<Link id="l00002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00003" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This pass loops over all of the functions and variables in the input module.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If the function or variable does not need to be preserved according to the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// client supplied callback, it is marked as internal.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This transformation would not be legal in a regular compilation, but it gets</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// extra information from the linker about what is safe.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For example: Internalizing a function with external linkage. Only if we are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// told it is only used from within this module, it is safe to do it.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We must assume that globals in llvm.used have a reference that not even</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the linker can see, so we don&#39;t internalize them.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For llvm.compiler.used the situation is a bit fuzzy. The assembler and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// linker can drop those symbols. If this pass is running as part of LTO,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// one might think that it could just drop llvm.compiler.used. The problem</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// is that even in LTO llvm doesn&#39;t see every reference. For example,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// we don&#39;t see references from function local inline assembly. To be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// conservative, we internalize symbols in llvm.compiler.used, but we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// keep llvm.compiler.used so that the symbol is not deleted by llvm.</span></CodeLine>
